About

Flying Squirrel is a multidisciplinary aerospace engineering studio led by Alexandre Quintart. We combine test facility experience, mission design, and modern software practices to solve high-stakes hypersonic and re-entry challenges.

Our teams thrive at the intersection of research and deployment: translating prototype algorithms into resilient tooling, instrumenting labs for automated acquisition, and shaping material characterization programs that accelerate certification.

From NASA research collaborations to partnerships with leading research institutes, we support projects where precision, repeatability, and insight matter most.

Follow Our Work

Lab automation notes, mission analytics drops, and open-source releases.

© 2025 Flying Squirrel · Alexandre Quintart

arcjetCV

Arc jet Computer Vision (arcjetCV) streamlines analysis of high-speed footage from hypersonic ground tests. Automated pipelines track recession, sting motion, and shock standoff distance, removing manual processing bottlenecks and increasing repeatability. The software couples convolutional neural networks, decision trees, and unsupervised clustering to isolate meaningful signal from high-noise environments.

The graphical interface guides operators through data ingestion, time-series visualization, and export. The resulting analytics have been used to reveal non-linear ablation effects and reduce uncertainty across modeling and validation campaigns.

STARscan

Spatial Targeting and Alignment Rig for Scanning (STARscan) is a custom 3D scanning system engineered for arcjet test article workflows. Purpose-built hardware and photogrammetry reconstruction deliver full-body scans in under two minutes with 0.5 mm accuracy, dramatically reducing turnaround between pre- and post-test inspections.

STARscan addresses data management and security considerations with structured capture protocols and repeatable alignment routines. The approach blends open-source tooling with bespoke automation to scale to large campaigns.

TomoSAM

TomoSAM extends Meta's Segment Anything Model to volumetric tomography within the 3D Slicer ecosystem. The plug-in accelerates segmentation workflows for complex CT and MR datasets, delivering consistent results across research and clinical teams.

The project demonstrates Flying Squirrel's commitment to open-source collaboration and reproducibility in tooling that benefits both aerospace materials research and medical imaging communities.

DAO-TPM

Design, Analysis, and Optimization of Thermal Protection Materials (DAO-TPM) links mission design, aerothermal environments, and TPS microstructure modeling in a cohesive Python framework. The toolkit, complete with a graphical interface, enables rapid scenario exploration and decision-making for atmospheric entry challenges.

Leveraging MEDLI in-flight datasets and extensible simulation blocks, DAO-TPM equips teams to evaluate material performance and iterate on architectures with confidence.

BEAST

Big-data Efficient and Automated Science Transfer (BEAST) is an open-source data infrastructure developed for the NASA Ames arc jet facilities. The platform replaces fragmented lab data practices with a unified system that synchronizes video, time-series measurements, and metadata to accelerate downstream analysis.

Built on Python’s Django framework and the broader data science stack, BEAST operationalizes the FAIR principles—making arc jet datasets findable, accessible, interoperable, and reusable. Automated ingestion pipelines, role-tailored dashboards, and machine learning hooks streamline experiment turnaround and unlock cross-test insights for researchers and operators alike.

Read the NASA AIAA SciTech Paper

MultiTraces

MultiTraces adapts the arcjetCV time segmentation engine to quickly identify relevant sequences across full-day test recordings. By analyzing brightness traces with a 1D CNN, the system flags sample insertions and other events that warrant operator review.

The tooling reduces manual browsing effort, shortens turnaround between tests, and maintains a traceable log of campaign highlights.
